schema.description:
The information about the input media file. The value is a JSON string. You must perform the following operations to add the OSS bucket in which the input media file is stored as a media bucket: Log on to the **MPS console**, choose **Workflows** > **Media Buckets** in the left-side navigation pane, and then click **Add Bucket**. After you add the OSS bucket as a media bucket, you must perform URL encoding for the OSS object. For example, `{"Bucket":"example-bucket","Location":"example-location","Object":"example%2Fexample.flv"}` indicates the `example-bucket.example-location.aliyuncs.com/example/example.flv` file.

> The OSS bucket must reside in the same region as your MPS service.
The custom data. The custom data can contain letters, digits, and hyphens (-), and can be up to 1,024 bytes in length. The custom data cannot start with a special character.

The ID of the MPS queue to which the analysis job is submitted. To view the ID of the MPS queue, log on to the **MPS console** and choose **Global Settings** > **Pipelines** in the left-side navigation pane.

Specifies whether to enable the asynchronous mode for the job. We recommend that you set this parameter to true. Valid values:

*   **true**: enables the asynchronous mode.
*   **false**: does not enable the asynchronous mode.
The response parameters.

MediaInfoJob.description: The details of the media information analysis job.

CreationTime.description: The time when the job was created.

State.description:
The status of the job. Valid values:

*   **Success**: The job is successful.
*   **Fail**: The job fails.
*   **Analyzing**: The job is being run.

Code.description: The error code returned if the job fails.

Message.description: The error message returned if the job fails.
Message.example: The parameter ”*” does not conform to the JSON Object specification

PipelineId.description: The ID of the MPS queue to which the analysis job is submitted.

Async.description: Indicates whether the job is run in asynchronous mode.

Input.description: The information about the input media file.

Object.description: The name of the OSS object that is used as the input media file.

Location.description: The region in which the OSS bucket that stores the input media file resides.

Bucket.description: The name of the OSS bucket in which the input media file is stored.

MNSMessageResult.description: The message sent by Message Service (MNS) to notify users of the job result.

MessageId.description: The ID of the message that is returned if the job is successful. This parameter is not returned if the job fails.

ErrorMessage.description: The error message that is returned if the job fails. This parameter is not returned if the job is successful.

ErrorCode.description: The error code that is returned if the job fails. This parameter is not returned if the job is successful.
ErrorCode.example: The parameter \"Input\" does not conform to the JSON Object specification

Properties.description: The properties of the input media file.

Width.description: The width of the video. Unit: pixel.

Height.description: The height of the video. Unit: pixel.

Duration.description: The duration of the input media file. Unit: seconds.

Fps.description: The frame rate.

Bitrate.description: The bitrate. Unit: Kbit/s.

FileFormat.description: The format of the input media file.

Streams.description: The media streams that are contained in the input media file.

VideoStream.description: The video streams. A media file can contain up to four video streams.

items.description: The response parameters.

Height.description: The height of the video. Unit: pixel.

CodecTagString.description: The tag string of the encoding format.

NetworkCost.description: The network bandwidth that is consumed.

PreloadTime.description: The time consumed to preload the video.

CostBandwidth.description: The maximum bandwidth that is consumed.

Width.description: The width of the video. Unit: pixel.

Index.description: The sequence number of the video stream. The value indicates the position of the video stream in all video streams. The sequence number of the first video stream to be played can be specified in some players. Default value: 1.

Lang.description: The language.

CodecLongName.description: The full name of the encoding format.

Rotate.description: The rotation angle of the video.

Bitrate.description: The bitrate. Unit: Kbit/s.

HasBFrames.description: Indicates whether the video stream contains bidirectional frames (B-frames). A value of 1 indicates that the video stream contains B-frames. A value of 0 indicates that the video stream does not contain B-frames.

Profile.description: The codec profile.

StartTime.description: The start time of the video stream.

Dar.description: The display aspect ratio (DAR). DAR is the proportional relationship between the width and the height of a video. The value is used to determine whether the video is in portrait mode or landscape mode.

CodecName.description:
The short name of the encoding format. Valid values:

*   **h264**
*   **h265**
*   **gif**
*   **webp**

Duration.description: The duration of the video stream. Unit: seconds.

Fps.description: The frame rate.

CodecTag.description: The tag of the encoding format.

AudioStream.description: The audio streams. A media file can contain up to four audio streams.

items.description: The response parameters.

Index.description: The sequence number of the audio stream. The value indicates the position of the audio stream in all audio streams.

ChannelLayout.description: The output layout of the sound channels.

Lang.description: The language.

CodecLongName.description: The full name of the encoding format.

Bitrate.description: The bitrate. Unit: Kbit/s.

CodecTagString.description: The tag string of the encoding format.

StartTime.description: The start time of the audio stream.

CodecName.description:
The short name of the encoding format. Default value: acc. Valid values:

*   **acc**
*   **mp3**
*   **mp4**
*   **ogg**
*   **flac**

Duration.description: The duration of the audio stream. Unit: seconds.

CodecTag.description: The tag of the encoding format.

SubtitleStream.description: The subtitle streams. A media file can contain up to four subtitle streams.

items.description: The response parameters.

Index.description: The sequence number of the subtitle stream. The value indicates the position of the subtitle stream in all subtitle streams.

StartTime.description: The start time of the subtitle stream.

CodecName.description:
The short name of the encoding format. Valid values:

*   **srt**
*   **ass**

Lang.description: The language.

CodecLongName.description: The full name of the encoding format.

Duration.description: The duration of the audio stream. Unit: seconds.

CodecTag.description: The tag of the encoding format.

CodecTagString.description: The tag string of the encoding format.

Format.description: The format information.

NumPrograms.description: The total number of program streams.

Size.description: The size of the file. Unit: bytes.

NumStreams.description: The total number of media streams.

FormatLongName.description: The full name of the container format.

Duration.description: The duration of the input media file. Unit: seconds.

Bitrate.description: The total bitrate. Unit: Kbit/s.

FormatName.description: The short name of the container format. For more information about the parameters, see [Parameter details](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/zh/apsaravideo-for-media-processing/latest/parameter-details-a).

FileSize.description: The size of the file. Unit: bytes.

SubmitMediaInfoJob.title: SubmitMediaInfoJob
SubmitMediaInfoJob.summary: Submits a media information analysis job.
SubmitMediaInfoJob.description:
After you call the SubmitMediaInfoJob operation, ApsaraVideo Media Processing (MPS) analyzes the input media file and generates the analysis results. You can call the [QueryMediaInfoJobList](~~29221~~) operation to query the analysis results.

> We recommend that you submit a media information analysis job after you confirm that the media file is uploaded to Object Storage Service (OSS). You can configure upload callbacks to be notified of the upload status of files.

### QPS limit

You can call this operation up to 50 times per second per account. Requests that exceed this limit are dropped and you will experience service interruptions. We recommend that you take note of this limit when you call this operation. For more information, see [QPS limit](~~342832~~).

schema.description:
The IDs of the media information analysis jobs.

*   You can query up to 10 jobs at a time. Separate multiple IDs with commas (,).
*   You can obtain the details from the response parameters of the [SubmitMediaInfoJob](~~602827~~) operation.

>  If you do not specify the JobIds parameter, the **InvalidParameter** error code is returned.

items.description: The IDs of the media information analysis jobs that do not exist. If all specified jobs exist, the response does not contain this parameter.

MediaInfoJob.description: The details of each returned media information analysis job.

CreationTime.description: The time when the job was created.

State.description:
The status of the job.

*   **Analyzing**: The job is being run.
*   **Success**: The job is successful.
*   **Fail**: The job fails.

Code.description: The error code returned if the job fails.

Message.description: The error message returned if the job fails.
Message.example: The parameter ”*” does not conform to the JSON Object specification

PipelineId.description: The ID of the MPS queue.

Async.description: Indicates whether the job is in asynchronous mode.

Input.description: The information about the job input.

Object.description: The name of the Object Storage Service (OSS) object that is used as the input file.

Location.description: The ID of the OSS region.

Bucket.description: The OSS bucket in which the input file is stored.

MNSMessageResult.description: The message sent by MNS to notify you of the job result.

MessageId.description: The ID of the message returned if the job was successful. This parameter is not returned if the job fails.

ErrorMessage.description: The error message returned if the job failed. This parameter is not returned if the job is successful.
ErrorMessage.example: The parameter \"Input\" does not conform to the JSON Object specification

ErrorCode.description: The error code returned if the job failed. This parameter is not returned if the job is successful.

QueryMediaInfoJobList.title: QueryMediaInfoJobList
QueryMediaInfoJobList.summary: Queries the results of media information analysis jobs.
QueryMediaInfoJobList.description:
*   In asynchronous mode, the media information can be retrieved only after the Message Service (MNS) callback of **submitting a media information job** is returned. If you have not retrieved the media information for a long period, the job may have failed.
*   You can call this operation to query up to 10 media information analysis jobs at a time.
*   By default, returned jobs are sorted in descending order by CreationTime.

### QPS limit

You can call this operation up to 100 times per second per account. Requests that exceed this limit are dropped and you will experience service interruptions. We recommend that you take note of this limit when you call this operation. For more information, see [QPS limit](~~342832~~).
QueryMediaInfoJobList.responseParamsDescription:
**Callback parameters**

When the status of the media information analysis job changes, MPS sends a message to the specified MNS queue. For more information about how to specify an MNS queue for receiving callbacks, see the [UpdatePipeline](~~188374~~) topic. The callback message is a JSON string that contains the parameters described in the following table.

```
{
  "Type": "MediaInfo",
  "State": "Success",
  "JobId": "bb558c1cc25b45309aab5be44d19****",
  "UserData": "{\"key\":\"value\"}",
  "RequestId": "B52658D4-07AB-43CD-82B0-210958A6****"
}
```

|Parameter|Type|Description|
|---|---|---|
|Type|String|The value is fixed to MediaInfo, which indicates a media information analysis job.|
|JobId|String|The unique ID of the job.|
|State|String|The current status of the job. The value is the same as the value of the State parameter returned in the QueryMediaInfoJobList operation.|
|UserData|String|The user data that was specified for the job in the SubmitMediaInfoJob operation.|

schema.description:
The information about the input file. For more information, see the "Input" section of the [Parameter details](~~29253~~) topic.

> 

*   The path of an Object Storage Service (OSS) object must be URL-encoded in UTF-8 before you use the path in MPS.

*   The OSS bucket must reside in the same region as your MPS service.

The job output configurations. For more information, see the "Output" section of the [Parameter details](~~29253~~) topic.

*   Specify the value in a JSON array of Output objects. You can specify up to 30 Output objects.

The name of the OSS bucket that stores the output file.

*   For more information about the term bucket, see [Terms](~~31827~~).

The region in which the OSS bucket that stores the output file resides.

*   The OSS bucket must reside in the same region as MPS.
*   For more information about the term bucket, see [Terms](~~31827~~).

The ID of the MPS queue. For more information, see [Terms](~~31827~~).

*   To obtain the ID of an MPS queue, you can log on to the [MPS console](https://mps.console.aliyun.com/overview) and choose **Global Settings** > **MPS Queue and Callback** in the left-side navigation pane.
*   If you want to receive asynchronous message notifications, associate an MNS queue or topic with the MPS queue. For more information, see [Receive notifications](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/zh/apsaravideo-for-media-processing/latest/receive-message-notifications).
The response parameters.

JobResult.description: The transcoding jobs that are generated.

Job.description: The details of the job. If the job fails to be submitted, no job ID is generated.

CreationTime.description: The time when the job was created.

FinishTime.description: The time when the job was complete.

State.description:
The state of the job. Valid values:

*   **Submitted**
*   **TranscodeFail**

Code.description: The error code returned if the job failed. This parameter is not returned if the job was successful.

Message.description: The error message returned if the job failed. This parameter is not returned if the job was successful.
Message.example: The operation has failed due to some unknown error, exception or failure.

Video.description:
The video configurations.

>  If this parameter is specified, **AliyunVideoCodec** in the template specified by **TemplateId** is overwritten.

Bufsize.description:
The size of the buffer.

*   Unit: KB.
*   Default value: **6000**.

Degrain.description: The strength of the independent noise reduction algorithm.

BitrateBnd.description: The average bitrate range of the video.

Max.description: The upper limit of the total bitrate. Unit: Kbit/s.

Min.description: The lower limit of the total bitrate. Unit: Kbit/s.

PixFmt.description:
The pixel format of the video.

*   The default pixel format can be **yuv420p** or the pixel format of the input file.

*   Valid values: standard pixel formats such as **yuv420p** and **yuvj420p**.

    **

    **Note** If a non-standard pixel format such as yuvj420p(pc, bt470bg/bt470bg/smpte170m) is used, compatibility with the pixel format must be configured. Otherwise, the transcoding job fails.

Pad.description:
The black borders that are added to the video.

*   The value is in the width:height:left:top format.
*   Unit: pixel.

Codec.description:
The video codec.

*   Valid values: **H.264**, **H.265**, **GIF**, and **WEBP**.
*   Default value: **H.264**.

Height.description:
The height of the video.

*   Unit: pixel.
*   Default value: the height of the input video.

Qscale.description: The level of quality control on the video.

Crop.description:
The method of video cropping. Valid values:

*   **border**: Black borders are automatically detected and removed.
*   A value in the format of width:height:left:top: The video is cropped based on the custom settings.

Bitrate.description: The bitrate of the output video. Unit: Kbit/s.

Maxrate.description: The maximum bitrate of the video. Unit: Kbit/s.

Profile.description:
The encoding profile. This parameter is returned only for the H.264 codec. Default value: **high**. Valid values:

>  If multiple definitions are involved, we recommend that you use baseline for the lowest definition to ensure normal playback on low-definition devices, and use main or high for other definitions.

*   **baseline**: applicable to mobile devices.
*   **main**: applicable to standard-definition devices.
*   **high**: applicable to high-definition devices.

Crf.description:
The constant rate factor.

*   If **Crf** is returned, the value of **Bitrate** is invalid.
*   Default value if the value of Codec is H.264: **23**. Default value if the value of Codec is H.265: **26**.

Gop.description:
The maximum interval between keyframes or the maximum number of frames in a frame group. Unit: seconds.

*   Default value: 10.
*   If the maximum number of frames is returned, the value does not have a unit.

Width.description:
The width of the video.

*   Unit: pixel.
*   Default value: **the width of the input video**.

Fps.description:
The frame rate.

*   Unit: frames per second.
*   Valid values: 0 to 60. The value is 60 if the frame rate of the input file exceeds 60.
*   Default value: the frame rate of the input file.

Preset.description:
The preset video algorithm. Default value: **medium**. Valid values:

*   **veryfast**
*   **fast**
*   **medium**
*   **slow**
*   **slower**

ScanMode.description:
The scan mode. Valid values:

*   If this parameter is **empty**, the scan mode of the input file is used.
*   **auto**: automatic deinterlacing.
*   **progressive**: progressive scan.
*   **interlaced**: interlaced scan.
*   **By default**, this parameter is empty.

**Best practice**: Interlaced scan consumes less bandwidth than progressive scan, but the image quality is poor. Therefore, mainstream video production uses progressive scan.

*   If **progressive scan** or **interlaced scan** is used when the scan mode of the input file is neither of them, the transcoding job fails.
*   We recommend that you use **the scan mode of the input file** or **automatic deinterlacing** to improve compatibility.

TransConfig.description:
The general transcoding configurations.

>  If this parameter is specified in the request, the corresponding parameter in the specified transcoding template are overwritten.

IsCheckAudioBitrate.description:
Indicates whether the audio bitrate is checked. If the bitrate of the output audio is higher than that of the input audio, the input bitrate is retained and the specified audio bitrate does not take effect. This parameter has a lower priority than IsCheckAudioBitrateFail. Valid values:

*   **true**

*   **false**

*   Default value:

    *   If this parameter is empty and the codec of the output audio is different from the codec of the input audio, the default value is false.
    *   If this parameter is empty and the codec of the output audio is the same as the codec of the input audio, the default value is true.

TransMode.description:
The transcoding mode. Valid values:

*   **onepass**: transcoding based on one-pass algorithms, which has higher accuracy.
*   **twopass**: transcoding based on two-pass algorithms, which has lower accuracy.
*   **CBR**: transcoding based on a fixed bitrate.

IsCheckReso.description:
Indicates whether the resolution is checked. If the output resolution is higher than the input resolution based on the width or height, the input resolution is retained. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false**
*   Default value: **false**.

IsCheckVideoBitrateFail.description:
Indicates whether the video bitrate is checked. If the bitrate of the output video is higher than that of the input video, a transcoding failure is returned without transcoding the video. This parameter has a higher priority than**IsCheckVideoBitrate**. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false**
*   Default value: **false**.

AdjDarMethod.description:
The method of resolution adjustment. Default value: **none**. Valid values:

*   rescale: The video image is resized.
*   crop: The video image is cropped.
*   pad: The video image is scaled out to fill the view.
*   none: The resolution is not adjusted.

IsCheckVideoBitrate.description:
Indicates whether the video bitrate is checked. If the bitrate of the output video is higher than that of the input video, the input bitrate is retained. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false**
*   Default value: **false**.

IsCheckResoFail.description:
Indicates whether the resolution is checked. This parameter has a higher priority than IsCheckReso. If the output resolution is higher than the input resolution based on the width or height, a transcoding failure is returned without transcoding the video. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false**
*   Default value: **false**.

IsCheckAudioBitrateFail.description:
Indicates whether the audio bitrate is checked. This parameter has a higher priority than **IsCheckAudioBitrate**. If the bitrate of the output audio is higher than that of the input audio, a transcoding failure is returned without transcoding the audio. Valid values:

*   **false**
*   **true**

Encryption.description: The encryption configurations. Only outputs in the M3U8 format are supported.

Type.description: The encryption type. Only **hls-aes-128** may be returned.

Key.description: The key that is used to encrypt the video.

KeyType.description: The key encryption method. Keys cannot be transmitted to MPS in plaintext. Keys must be encrypted by using Base64 or Key Management Service (KMS). For example, if the key is encryptionkey128, you can encrypt the key by using the following method: Base64("encryptionkey128") or KMS(Base64("encryptionkey128").

Id.description: The encryption ID.

KeyUri.description: The URL that is used to request the key. The URL is Base64-encoded.

SkipCnt.description: The number of unencrypted frames at the beginning of the video. Leaving these frames unencrypted enables video playback to quickly start.

WaterMark.description:
The watermarks.

>  If watermarks are truncated or fail to be generated, check whether the text watermarks that you add contain special characters. If the text watermarks contain special characters, you must escape the special characters before you add the watermarks. Alternatively, you can [submit a ticket](https://workorder-intl.console.aliyun.com/?spm=5176.12246746.top-nav.dticket.68797bbcm8H408#/ticket/add/?productId=1232) to contact Alibaba Cloud customer service for compatibility processing.

Type.description:
The type of the watermark. If this parameter is specified in the request, the corresponding parameter in the watermark template is overwritten. For more information, see [Parameter details](~~29253~~). Valid values:

*   **Image**
*   **Text**

ReferPos.description:
The position of the watermark. If this parameter is specified in the request, the corresponding parameter in the watermark template is overwritten. Valid values:

*   **TopRight**
*   **TopLeft**
*   **BottomRight**
*   **BottomLeft**

Dx.description:
The horizontal offset of the watermark image relative to the output video. If this parameter is specified in the request, the corresponding parameter in the watermark template is overwritten. Default value: 0. The value can be an integer or a decimal number.

*   An integer indicates the pixel value of the horizontal offset.

    *   Valid values: **\[8,4096]**.
    *   Unit: pixel.

*   A decimal number indicates the ratio of the horizontal offset to the width in the output video resolution.

    *   Valid values: (0,1).
    *   The decimal number can be accurate to four decimal places, such as 0.9999. Excess digits are automatically deleted.

Width.description:
The width of the watermark image. If this parameter is specified in the request, the corresponding parameter in the watermark template is overwritten. The value can be an integer or a decimal number.

*   An integer indicates the pixel value of the watermark width.

    *   Valid values: **\[8,4096]**.
    *   Unit: pixel.

*   A decimal number indicates the ratio of the watermark width to the width in the output video resolution.

    *   Valid values: **(0,1)**.
    *   The decimal number can be accurate to four decimal places, such as 0.9999. Excess digits are automatically deleted.

Height.description:
The height of the watermark. If this parameter is specified in the request, the corresponding parameter in the watermark template is overwritten. The value can be an integer or a decimal number.

*   An integer indicates the pixel value of the watermark height.

    *   Valid values: **\[8,4096]**.
    *   Unit: pixel.

*   A decimal number indicates the ratio of the watermark height to the height in the output video resolution.

    *   Valid values: **(0,1)**.
    *   The decimal number can be accurate to four decimal places, such as 0.9999. Excess digits are automatically deleted.

InputFile.description: The watermark input file. PNG images and MOV files are supported.

Object.description: The name of the OSS object that is used as the input file.

Location.description: The ID of the OSS region in which the input file is stored.

Bucket.description: The name of the OSS bucket in which the input file is stored.

WaterMarkTemplateId.description: The ID of the watermark template.

Dy.description:
The vertical offset of the watermark image relative to the output video. If this parameter is specified in the request, the corresponding parameter in the watermark template is overwritten. The value can be an integer or a decimal number.

*   An integer indicates the pixel value of the vertical offset.

    *   Valid values: **\[8,4096]**.
    *   Unit: pixel.

*   A decimal number indicates the ratio of the vertical offset to the height in the output video resolution.

    *   Valid values: **(0,1)**.
    *   The decimal number can be accurate to four decimal places, such as 0.9999. Excess digits are automatically deleted.

WaterMarkConfigUrl.description: The URL of the watermark configuration file.

DeWatermark.description: The configurations of watermark blurring. The value is a JSON object. For more information, see the **DeWatermark** section of the [Parameter details](~~29253~~) topic.

M3U8NonStandardSupport.description: The non-standard support configuration for M3U8. The value is a JSON object. For more information, see the **M3U8NonStandardSupport** section of the [Parameter details](~~29253~~) topic.

TS.description: The non-standard support configurations for TS files. The value is a JSON object. For more information, see the **TS** section of the [Parameter details](~~29253~~) topic.

SizeSupport.description:
Indicates whether the size of the TS file is generated in the output M3U8 video. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false**

Md5Support.description:
Indicates whether the output of the MD5 value of the TS file is supported in the M3U8 video. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false**

Priority.description:
The priority of the job in the MPS queue to which the job is added.

*   A value of **10** indicates the highest priority.
*   Default value: **6**.

Audio.description:
The audio configurations.

>  If this parameter is specified in the request, the corresponding configurations in the specified transcoding template are overwritten.

Profile.description:
The codec profile of the audio.

>  Valid values if the value of **Codec** is **aac**: **aac_low**, **aac_he**, **aac_he_v2**, **aac_ld**, and **aac_eld**.

Codec.description:
The audio codec.

*   Valid values: **aac**, **mp3**, **vorbis**, and **flac**.
*   Default value: **aac**.

Samplerate.description:
The sampling rate.

*   Valid values: **22050**, **32000**, **44100**, **48000**, and **96000**.
*   Unit: Hz.
*   Default value: **44100**.

>  If the video container format is FLV and the audio codec is MP3, the value of this parameter cannot be 32000, 48000, or 96000. If the audio codec is MP3, the value of this parameter cannot be 96000.

Qscale.description: The level of quality control on the audio.

Channels.description:
The number of sound channels.

*   If the value of Codec is mp3, the value of this parameter can only be **1** or **2**.
*   If the value of Codec is aac, the value of this parameter can only be **1**, **2**, **4**, **5**, **6**, or **8**.
*   Default value: **2**.

Method.description:
The method that is used to adjust the volume. Valid values:

*   **auto**
*   **dynamic**
*   **linear**

Level.description:
The volume adjustment range.

*   Unit: decibel.
*   Default value: **-20**.

Bitrate.description:
The audio bitrate of the output file.

*   Unit: Kbit/s.
*   Default value: **128**.

AudioStreamMap.description:
The sequence number of the audio stream.

*   Format: 0:a:{Sequence number}. Example: 0:a:0.
*   The sequence number is the index of the audio stream in the list and starts from 0.
*   If no sequence number is specified, the default audio stream is used.

Start.description:
The start point in time of the clip.

*   Format: `hh:mm:ss[.SSS]` or `sssss[.SSS]`.
*   Examples: 01:59:59.999 and 32000.23.

RoleArn.description: The Alibaba Cloud Resource Name (ARN) of the Resource Access Management (RAM) role used for delegated authorization.

MergeURL.description:
The OSS URL of the clip.

*   Example: `http://example-bucket-****.oss-cn-hangzhou.aliyuncs.com/example-object-****.flv`.
*   The OSS URL of the object must be URL-encoded by using the UTF-8 standard.

Duration.description:
The duration of the clip.

*   Format: `hh:mm:ss[.SSS]` or `sssss[.SSS]`.
*   Examples: 01:59:59.999 and 32000.23.

SuperReso.description: The configurations for using the resolution of the source video.

IsHalfSample.description:
Indicates whether parameters related to the sampling rate are obtained. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false**

Map.description: The video track. Format: `0:{Stream}:{Stream sequence number}`, which is `0:v:{video_index}`. The value of Stream is v, which indicates a video stream. The sequence number is the index of the video stream in the list and starts from 0.

OutSubtitleFile.description: The details of the output file.

RoleArn.description: The ARN of the RAM role used for delegated authorization.

Object.description: The name of the OSS object that is used as the output file.

Location.description: The ID of the OSS region in which the output file is stored.

Bucket.description: The name of the OSS bucket in which the input file is stored.

Success.description:
Indicates whether the job was created. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false**

Message.description: The error message returned if the job failed to be created. This parameter is not returned if the job was created.
Message.example: The specified parameter “%s” cannot be null.

Type.description:
The type of the watermark. If this parameter is specified in the request, the corresponding parameter in the watermark template is overwritten. Valid values:

*   **Image** (default)
*   **Text**

Alpha.description:
The transparency of the text or image.

*   Value values: **(0,1]**.
*   Default value: **1.0**.

InputFile.description: The details of the input file.

Object.description: The name of the OSS object that is used as the input file.

Location.description: The ID of the OSS region in which the input file is stored.

Bucket.description: The name of the OSS bucket in which the input file is stored.

VideoStreamMap.description:
The sequence number of the video stream.

*   Format: 0:a:{Sequence number}. Example: 0:a:0.
*   The sequence number is the index of the video stream in the list and starts from 0.
*   If no sequence number is specified, the default video stream is used.

OutputFile.description: The details of the output file.

RoleArn.description: The ARN of the RAM role used for delegated authorization.

Object.description: The name of the OSS object that is used as the output file.

Location.description: The ID of the OSS region in which the output file is stored.

Bucket.description: The name of the OSS bucket in which the input file is stored.

Amix.description: The audio tracks that are mixed.

Map.description: The audio track that is mixed. Format: 0:a:{audio_index}. Example: 0:a:0.

Start.description: The start time. The value is in the number or time format. Examples: 1:25:36.240 and 32000.23.

AmixURL.description:
The URL of the audio track that is mixed as the background music.

*   The URL can be an OSS URL or the string `input`.
*   A value of input indicates that two audio tracks are mixed in a video.

Duration.description: The duration of the mixed audio track. The value is in the number or time format.

MixDurMode.description:
The mode to specify the mixing duration. Valid values: **first** and **long**.

*   **first**: The length of the output media equals the length of the input media.
*   **long**: The length of the output media equals the length of the output media or the length of the input media, whichever is longer.
*   Default value: **long**.

Rotate.description: The rotation angle of the video, in the clockwise direction.

Format.description:
The container format.

*   Default value: **mp4**.
*   Video formats include FLV, MP4, HLS (M3U8 + TS), and MPEG-DASH (MPD + fMP4).
*   Audio formats include MP3, MP4, Ogg, FLAC, and M4A.
*   Image formats include GIF and WebP.
*   If the container format is GIF, the video codec must be GIF.
*   If the container format is WebP, the video codec must be WebP.
*   If the container format is FLV, the video codec cannot be H.265.

TimeSpan.description: The time span of the clip.

Seek.description:
The start time.

*   Format: `hh:mm:ss[.SSS]` or `sssss[.SSS]`.
*   Valid values: `[00:00:00.000,23:59:59.999]` or `[0.000,86399.999]`.

Duration.description:
The duration of the clip.

*   Format: `hh:mm:ss[.SSS]` or `sssss[.SSS]`.
*   Valid values: `[00:00:00.000,23:59:59.999]` or `[0.000,86399.999]`.

MergeConfigUrl.description:
The URL of the merging configuration file. Only one of **MergeList** and **MergeConfigUrl** takes effect.

*   The configuration file specified by MergeConfigUrl can contain up to 50 clips.
*   MergeConfigUrl indicates the URL of the configuration file for merging clips.
*   Make sure that the configuration file is stored as an object in OSS and that MPS can access the OSS object. For information about the file content, see the details about merging parameters.
*   Example of the content of the merging configuration file: `{"MergeList":[{"MergeURL":"http://exampleBucket****.oss-cn-hangzhou.aliyuncs.com/video_01.mp4"}]}`.

Opening.description: The opening parts. The value is a JSON object.

openUrl.description: The OSS URL of the opening part.

Start.description:
The amount of time after which the opening part is played. The value starts from 0.

*   Unit: seconds.
*   Default value: **0**.

Width.description:
The width of the opening part.

*   Valid values: values in the range of **(0,4096)**, **-1**, and **full**.
*   Default value: **-1**.
*   A value of **-1** indicates that the width of the source of the opening part is retained.
*   A value of **full** indicates that the width of the main part is used for the opening part.

Height.description:
The height of the opening part.

*   Valid values: values in the range of **(0,4096)**, **-1**, and **full**.
*   Default value: **-1**.
*   A value of **-1** indicates that the height of the source of the opening part is retained.
*   A value of **full** indicates that the height of the main part is used for the opening part.

MuxConfig.description: The transmuxing configurations. If this parameter is specified in the request, the corresponding configurations in the specified transcoding template are overwritten.

FinalDelay.description: The duration for which the final frame is paused. Unit: centisecond.

DitherMode.description: The color dithering algorithm of the palette. Valid values: **sierra** and **bayer**.

IsCustomPalette.description:
Indicates whether a custom palette is used. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false**

Segment.description: The segment configuration. The value is a JSON object.

Duration.description:
The length of the segment. The value is an integer. Unit: seconds.

*   Valid values: **\[1,10]**.
*   Default value: **10**.

TailSlate.description: The ending parts. The value is a JSON object.

BgColor.description: The color of the bars that are added to the ending part if the size of the ending part is smaller than that of the main part. Default value: **White**. For more information, see [Background colors](https://docs-aliyun.cn-hangzhou.oss.aliyun-inc.com/assets/attach/29253/cn_zh/1502784952344/color.txt?spm=a2c4g.11186623.2.63.241240f77qp3Yy\&file=color.txt).

IsMergeAudio.description:
Indicates whether the audio content of the ending part is merged. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false**

Width.description:
The width of the ending part.

*   Valid values: values in the range of **(0,4096)**, **-1**, and **full**.
*   A value of **-1** indicates that the width of the source of the ending part is retained. A value of **full** indicates that the width of the main part is used for the ending part.
*   Default value: -1.

Height.description:
The height of the ending part.

*   Valid values: values in the range of **(0,4096)**, **-1**, and **full**.
*   A value of **-1** indicates that the height of the source of the ending part is retained. A value of **full** indicates that the height of the main part is used for the ending part.
*   Default value: -1.

BlendDuration.description: The duration of the transition between the main part and the ending part. A fade transition is used: The last frame of the main part fades out, and the first frame of the ending part fades in. Unit: seconds. Default value: **0**.

TailUrl.description: The OSS URL of the ending part.

TemplateId.description: The ID of the transcoding template.

ExtSubtitle.description: The external subtitles. The value is a JSON array that contains up to **four** objects.

CharEnc.description:
The character set used by the external subtitle.

*   Valid values: **UTF-8**, **GBK**, **BIG5**, and **auto**.
*   Default value: **auto**.

>  If this parameter is set to **auto**, the detected character set may not be the actual character set. We recommend that you set this parameter to another value.

FontName.description: The font of the hardcoded subtitles converted from external subtitles. Default value: **SimSun**. For more information, see [Fonts](~~59950~~).

Input.description: The OSS object that is used as the external subtitle. The value is a JSON object. Files in the **SRT** or **ASS** format are supported.

Object.description: The name of the OSS object that is used as the input file.

Location.description: The ID of the OSS region in which the input file is stored.

Bucket.description: The name of the OSS bucket in which the input file is stored.

Map.description: The audio track. Format: `0:{Stream}:{Stream sequence number}`, which is `0:a:{audio_index}`. The value of Stream is a, which indicates an audio stream. The sequence number is the index of the audio stream in the list and starts from 0.

Width.description: The width of the video.

Height.description: The height of the video.

Duration.description: The duration of the video.

Fps.description: The frame rate of the video. The value is a number.

Bitrate.description: The bitrate of the video.

Index.description: The sequence number of the video stream. The value indicates the position of the video stream in all video streams.

Timebase.description: The time base of the video stream.

AvgFPS.description: The average frame rate of the video stream.

PixFmt.description: The pixel format of the video stream.

Sar.description: The sample aspect ratio (SAR) of the video stream.

Lang.description: The language of the video stream. For more information, see [FFmpeg documentation](https://www.ffmpeg.org/ffmpeg-all.html#Metadata) and [ISO 639](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO\_639-1\_codes).

CodecLongName.description: The full name of the codec.
CodecLongName.example: H.264 / AVC / MPEG-4 AVC / MPEG-4 part 10

Height.description: The height of the video stream in pixels.

Bitrate.description: The bitrate of the video stream.

CodecTagString.description: The tag string of the codec.

HasBFrames.description: Indicates whether the video stream contains B-frames.

Profile.description: The codec profile.

StartTime.description: The start time of the video stream.

NetworkCost.description: The network bandwidth that was consumed.

PreloadTime.description: The amount of time consumed to preload the video stream.

AvgBitrate.description: The average bitrate of the video stream.

CostBandwidth.description: The maximum bandwidth that was consumed.

Dar.description: The display aspect ratio (DAR) of the video stream.

CodecName.description: The short name of the codec.

Width.description: The width of the video stream in pixels.

Duration.description: The duration of the video stream.

Fps.description: The frame rate of the video stream.

Timebase.description: The time base of the audio stream.

Index.description: The sequence number of the audio stream. The value indicates the position of the audio stream in all audio streams.

ChannelLayout.description: The output layout of the sound channels.

Lang.description: The language of the audio stream. For more information, see [FFmpeg documentation](https://www.ffmpeg.org/ffmpeg-all.html#Metadata) and [ISO 639](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO\_639-1\_codes).

Samplerate.description: The sampling rate of the audio stream.

CodecLongName.description: The full name of the codec.

Bitrate.description: The bitrate of the audio stream.

CodecTagString.description: The tag string of the codec.

StartTime.description: The start time of the audio stream.

CodecName.description: The short name of the codec.

Duration.description: The duration of the audio stream.

Index.description: The sequence number of the subtitle stream. The value indicates the position of the subtitle stream in all subtitle streams.

Lang.description: The language of the subtitle stream. For more information, see [FFmpeg documentation](https://www.ffmpeg.org/ffmpeg-all.html#Metadata) and [ISO 639](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO\_639-1\_codes).

Format.description: The format information.

NumPrograms.description: The total number of program streams.

NumStreams.description: The total number of media streams.

FormatLongName.description: The full name of the container format.

Duration.description: The total duration.

Bitrate.description: The total bitrate.

FormatName.description: The short name of the container format. Valid values: mov, mp4, m4a, 3gp, 3g2, and mj2.

PipelineId.description: The ID of the MPS queue.

Input.description: The information about the job input.

Object.description: The name of the OSS object that is used as the job input.

Location.description: The ID of the OSS region in which the job input is stored.

Bucket.description: The name of the OSS bucket in which the job input is stored.

MNSMessageResult.description: The message sent by MNS to notify users of the job result.

MessageId.description: The ID of the error message returned if the job failed. This parameter is not returned if the job was successful.

ErrorMessage.description: The error message returned if the job failed. This parameter is not returned if the job was successful.
ErrorMessage.example: The resource operated "%s" cannot be found.

ErrorCode.description: The error code returned if the job failed. This parameter is not returned if the job was successful.

Success.description:
Indicates whether the job was successful. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false**

Code.description: The error code returned if the job failed to be created. This parameter is not returned if the job was created.

Message.description: The error message returned if the job failed to be created. This parameter is not returned if the job was created.
Message.example: The specified parameter "%s" cannot be null.

SubmitJobs.title: SubmitJobs
SubmitJobs.summary: Submits transcoding jobs. If the transcoding jobs and workflows created in the ApsaraVideo Media Processing (MPS) console cannot meet your business requirements, you can call the SubmitJobs operation to submit transcoding jobs. Specify transcoding parameters as required when you call the SubmitJobs operation.
SubmitJobs.description:
*   SubmitJobs is an asynchronous operation. After you submit transcoding jobs, the jobs are added to an MPS queue to be scheduled and run. The transcoding jobs may not have been complete when the response is returned. After you call this operation, you can call the [QueryJobList](~~602836~~) operation to query the job results. You can also associate a Message Service (MNS) queue or topic with the MPS queue to receive notifications on the jobs. For more information, see [Receive notifications](https://www.alibabacloud.com/help/zh/apsaravideo-for-media-processing/latest/receive-message-notifications).
*   An input file can be up to 100 GB in size. If the size of the input file exceeds this limit, the job may fail.
*   If you use an **intelligent preset template** to transcode an input file, you must first call the [SubmitAnalysisJob](~~29223~~) operation to submit a preset template analysis job. After the analysis job is complete, you can call the [QueryAnalysisJobList](~~29224~~)operation to obtain the available preset templates for the input file. When you submit a transcoding job, set TemplateId to the ID of an available preset template. If you specify a preset template that is not in the available preset templates, the transcoding job fails.
*   If you use a **static preset template** to transcode an input file, you do not need to submit a preset template analysis job.
*   If you want to use multiple accounts in MPS, you can create Resource Access Management (RAM) users by using your Alibaba Cloud account. For more information, see [Create a RAM user and grant permissions to the RAM user](~~42841~~). If the Alibaba Cloud account that is used to query transcoding jobs is not the one that is used to submit the transcoding jobs, no data is returned.
*   For information about transcoding FAQ, see [FAQ about MPS](~~38986~~).

### [](#qps)QPS limits

You can call this operation up to 100 times per second per account. Requests that exceed this limit are dropped, and you will experience service interruptions. We recommend that you take note of this limit when you call this operation. For more information, see [QPS limits](~~342832~~).

schema.description: The ID of the transcoding job to be canceled. You can log on to the **MPS console** and click **Tasks** in the left-side navigation pane to obtain job IDs. Alternatively, you can obtain job IDs from the response of the [SubmitJobs](~~29226~~) operation.
The response parameters.

CancelJob.title: CancelJob
CancelJob.description:
*   You can cancel a transcoding job only if the job is in the Submitted state.
*   We recommend that you call the **UpdatePipeline** operation to set the status of the ApsaraVideo Media Processing (MPS) queue to Paused before you cancel a job. This suspends job scheduling in the MPS queue. After the job is canceled, you must set the status of the MPS queue back to Active so that the other jobs in the MPS queue can be scheduled.

### QPS limit

You can call this operation up to 100 times per second per account. Requests that exceed this limit are dropped and you will experience service interruptions. We recommend that you take note of this limit when you call this operation. For more information, see [QPS limit](~~342832~~).

QueryJobList.summary: Queries transcoding jobs at a time by job ID.

schema.description:
The IDs of transcoding jobs. Separate multiple IDs with commas (,). You can query a maximum of 10 transcoding jobs at a time. You can log on to the [ApsaraVideo Media Processing (MPS) console](https://mps.console.aliyun.com/overview) and click **Tasks** in the left-side navigation pane to obtain job IDs. Alternatively, you can obtain job IDs from the response to the [SubmitJobs](~~29226~~) operation.

>  If you do not set the JobIds parameter, the `InvalidParameter` error code is returned.
The response parameters.

String.description: The list of nonexistent job IDs. If all queried job IDs exist, the response does not contain this parameter.

items.description: The nonexistent job ID.

CreationTime.description: The time when the job was created.

FinishTime.description: The time when the job was complete.

State.description:
The job state. Valid values:

*   **Submitted**: The job was submitted.
*   **Transcoding**: Transcoding is in process.
*   **TranscodeSuccess**: The job was successful.
*   **TranscodeFail**: The job failed.
*   **TranscodeCancelled**: The job was canceled.

Code.description: The error code returned if the job failed. If the job was successful, this parameter is not returned.

Message.description: The error message returned if the job failed. If the job was successful, this parameter is not returned.
Message.example: The specified parameter "%s" cannot be null.

Bufsize.description:
The buffer size.

*   Unit: KB.
*   Default value: **6000**.

Degrain.description: The strength of the independent noise reduction algorithm.

BitrateBnd.description: The average bitrate range of the video.

PixFmt.description: The pixel format of the video. Valid values: standard pixel formats such as yuv420p and yuvj420p.

Pad.description:
The black bars that are added to the video.

*   Unit: pixel.
*   Format: width:height:left:top.

Codec.description:
The video codec.

*   Valid values: H.264 and H.265.
*   Default value: H.264.

Height.description:
The height of the video.

*   Unit: pixel.
*   Default value: the height of the input video.

Qscale.description: The level of quality control on the video.

Crop.description:
The method of video cropping. Valid values:

*   **border**: automatically detects and removes borders.
*   A value in the width:height:left:top format: The video image is cropped based on custom settings.

Bitrate.description: The average bitrate of the video. Unit: Kbit/s.

Maxrate.description: The maximum bitrate of the video. Unit: Kbit/s.

Profile.description:
The codec profile of the video. Valid values: baseline, main, and high.

>  If multiple definitions are involved, we recommend that you use baseline for the lowest definition to ensure normal playback on low-end devices, and use main or high for other definitions.

*   **baseline**: applicable to mobile devices.
*   **main**: applicable to standard-definition devices.
*   **high**: applicable to high-definition devices.
*   Default value: **high**.

Crf.description:
The constant rate factor.

*   Default value when the value of Codec is H.264: **23**, default value when the value of Codec is H.265: **26**.
*   If the value of this parameter is returned, the value of Bitrate becomes invalid.

Gop.description:
The maximum interval between keyframes or the maximum number of frames in a frame group. Unit: seconds.

*   Default value: **250**.
*   If the maximum number of frames is returned, the value does not contain a unit.

Width.description:
The width of the video.

*   Unit: pixel.
*   Default value: the width of the input video.

Fps.description:
The frame rate of the video.

*   Unit: frames per second.
*   The value is 60 if the frame rate of the input file exceeds 60.
*   Default value: the frame rate of the input video.

Preset.description:
The preset video algorithm. Default value: **medium**. Valid values:

*   **veryfast**
*   **fast**
*   **medium**
*   **slow**
*   **slower**

ScanMode.description:
The scan mode. Valid values:

*   If this parameter is left **empty**, the scan mode of the input video is used.
*   **auto**: automatic deinterlacing.
*   **progressive**: progressive scan.
*   **interlaced**: interlaced scan.
*   **By default**, this parameter is left empty.

**Best practice**: The interlaced scan mode saves data traffic than the progressive scan mode but provides poor image quality. Therefore, the progressive scan mode is commonly used in mainstream video production.

*   If **progressive** or **interlaced** is used when the scan mode of the input video is neither of them, the transcoding job fails.
*   We recommend that you use **the scan mode of the input video** or **automatic deinterlacing** for higher compatibility.

TransConfig.description:
The general transcoding configurations.

>  If this parameter is specified in the request, the corresponding parameters in the specified transcoding template are overwritten.

IsCheckAudioBitrate.description:
Indicates whether the audio bitrate is checked. If the bitrate of the output audio is higher than that of the input audio, the input bitrate is retained and the specified audio bitrate does not take effect. This parameter has a lower priority than IsCheckAudioBitrateFail. Valid values:

*   **true**

*   **false**

*   Default value:

    *   If this parameter is empty and the codec of the output audio is different from that of the input audio, the default value is false.
    *   If this parameter is empty and the codec of the output audio is the same as that of the input audio, the default value is true.

TransMode.description:
The transcoding mode.

*   Valid values: onepass, twopass, and CBR.
*   Default value: **onepass**.

IsCheckReso.description:
Indicates whether the resolution is checked. If the output resolution is higher than the input resolution based on the width or height, the input resolution is retained. Valid values:

*   **true**:
*   **false**
*   Default value: **false**.

IsCheckVideoBitrateFail.description:
Indicates whether the video bitrate is checked. If the bitrate of the output video is higher than that of the input video, the input video is not transcoded and a transcoding failure is returned. This parameter has a higher priority than IsCheckVideoBitrate. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false**
*   Default value: **false**.

AdjDarMethod.description: The method of resolution adjustment. Default value: **none**. Valid values: rescale, crop, pad, and none.

IsCheckVideoBitrate.description:
Indicates whether the video bitrate is checked. If the bitrate of the output video is higher than that of the input video, the input bitrate is retained. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false**
*   Default value: **false**.

IsCheckResoFail.description:
Indicates whether the resolution is checked. If the output resolution is higher than the input resolution based on the width or height, a transcoding failure is returned. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false**
*   Default value: **false**.

IsCheckAudioBitrateFail.description:
Indicates whether the audio bitrate is checked. If the bitrate of the output audio is higher than that of the input audio, the input audio is not transcoded and a transcoding failure is returned. This parameter has a higher priority than IsCheckAudioBitrate. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false**
*   Default value: **false**.

Encryption.description: The encryption configurations. The encrypted video file is generated in the M3U8 format.

Type.description: The encryption type. Only **hls-aes-128** may be returned.

Key.description: The key that is used to encrypt the video.

KeyType.description:
The key encryption method. Valid values: Base64 and KMS.

>  For example, if the key is `encryptionkey128`, the key can be encrypted as `Base64("encryptionkey128")` or `KMS(Base64("encryptionkey128")` depending on the encryption method used.

Id.description: The encryption ID.

KeyUri.description: The URL that is used to request the key. The URL is Base64-encoded.

SkipCnt.description: The number of unencrypted frames at the beginning of the video. Leaving these frames unencrypted enables video playback to quickly start.

Type.description:
The type of the watermark. If this parameter is specified in the request, the corresponding parameter in the watermark template is overwritten. For more information, see [Parameter details](~~29253~~). Valid values:

*   Image
*   Text

ReferPos.description:
The position of the watermark. If this parameter is specified in the request, the corresponding parameter in the watermark template is overwritten. Valid values:

*   TopRight
*   TopLeft
*   BottomRight
*   BottomLeft

Dx.description:
The horizontal offset of the watermark image relative to the output video. If this parameter is specified in the request, the corresponding parameter in the watermark template is overwritten. Default value: 0. The value can be an integer or a decimal number.

*   An integer indicates the pixel value of the horizontal offset.

    *   Valid values: **\[8,4096]**.
    *   Unit: pixel.

*   A decimal number indicates the ratio of the horizontal offset to the width in the output video resolution.

    *   Valid values: (0,1).
    *   The decimal number can be accurate to four decimal places, such as 0.9999. Excessive digits are automatically discarded.

Width.description:
The width of the watermark image. If this parameter is specified in the request, the corresponding parameter in the watermark template is overwritten. The value can be an integer or a decimal number.

*   An integer indicates the pixel value of the watermark width.

    *   Valid values: **\[8,4096]**.
    *   Unit: pixel.

*   A decimal number indicates the ratio of the watermark width to the width in the output video resolution.

    *   Valid values: **(0,1)**.
    *   The decimal number can be accurate to four decimal places, such as 0.9999. Excessive digits are automatically discarded.

Height.description:
The height of the watermark image. If this parameter is specified in the request, the corresponding parameter in the watermark template is overwritten. The value can be an integer or a decimal number.

*   An integer indicates the pixel value of the watermark height.

    *   Valid values: **\[8,4096]**.
    *   Unit: pixel.

*   A decimal number indicates the ratio of the watermark height to the height in the output video resolution.

    *   Valid values: **(0,1)**.
    *   The decimal number can be accurate to four decimal places, such as 0.9999. Excessive digits are automatically discarded.

InputFile.description: The watermark input file. PNG images and MOV files are supported.

Object.description: The name of the Object Storage Service (OSS) object that is used as the input file.

Location.description: The OSS region in which the input file resides.

Bucket.description: The name of the OSS bucket in which the input file is stored.

WaterMarkTemplateId.description: The ID of the watermark template.

Dy.description:
The vertical offset of the watermark image relative to the output video. If this parameter is specified in the request, the corresponding parameter in the watermark template is overwritten. The value can be an integer or a decimal number.

*   An integer indicates the pixel value of the vertical offset.

    *   Valid values: **\[8,4096]**.
    *   Unit: pixel.

*   A decimal number indicates the ratio of the vertical offset to the height in the output video resolution.

    *   Valid values: **(0,1)**.
    *   The decimal number can be accurate to four decimal places, such as 0.9999. Excessive digits are automatically discarded.

WaterMarkConfigUrl.description: The URL of the watermark configuration file.

DeWatermark.description: The configurations of watermark blurring. The value is a JSON object. For more information, see the DeWatermark section of the [Parameter details](~~29253~~) topic.

M3U8NonStandardSupport.description: The non-standard support configurations for M3U8. The value is a JSON object. For more information, see the M3U8NonStandardSupport section of the [Parameter details](~~29253~~) topic.

TS.description: The non-standard support configurations for TS files. The value is a JSON object. For more information, see the TS section of the [Parameter details](~~29253~~) topic.

SizeSupport.description:
Indicates whether the output of the size of the TS file is supported in the M3U8 file. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false**

Md5Support.description:
Indicates whether the output of the MD5 value of the TS file is supported in the M3U8 file. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false**

Priority.description:
The priority of the job in the ApsaraVideo Media Processing (MPS) queue to which the job is added.

*   A value of 10 indicates the highest priority.
*   Default value: **6**.

Audio.description:
The audio configurations.

>  If this parameter is specified in the request, the corresponding parameters in the specified transcoding template are overwritten.

Profile.description: The codec profile of the audio. Valid values when the value of Codec is aac: aaclow, aache, aachev2, aacld, and aaceld.

Codec.description:
The audio codec.

*   Valid values: aac, mp3, vorbis, and flac.
*   Default value: **aac**.

Samplerate.description:
The sampling rate.

*   Valid values: 22050, 32000, 44100, 48000, and 96000.
*   Unit: Hz.
*   Default value: 44100.

>  If the video container format is FLV and the audio codec is MP3, the value of this parameter cannot be 32000, 48000, or 96000. If the audio codec is MP3, the value of this parameter cannot be 96000.

Qscale.description: The level of quality control on the audio.

Channels.description:
The number of sound channels.

*   Valid values: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, and 8.
*   Default value: **2**.

Method.description:
The method that is used to adjust the volume. Valid values:

*   **auto**
*   **dynamic**
*   **linear**

Level.description: The volume adjustment range. Default value: -20. Unit: dB.

Bitrate.description:
The audio bitrate of the output file.

*   Unit: Kbit/s.
*   Default value: **128**.

AudioStreamMap.description:
The sequence number of the audio stream.

*   Format: 0:a:{Sequence number}. Example: 0:a:0.
*   The sequence number is the index of the audio stream in the list and starts from 0.
*   If no sequence number is specified, the default audio stream is used.

Merge.description: The configurations of clip merging. Up to four clips can be merged.

Start.description:
The start point in time of the clip.

*   Format: `hh:mm:ss[.SSS]` or `sssss[.SSS]`.
*   Examples: 01:59:59.999 and 32000.23.

RoleArn.description: The Alibaba Cloud Resource Name (ARN) of the Resource Access Management (RAM) role used for delegated authorization.

MergeURL.description:
The OSS URL of the clip.

*   Example: `http://example-bucket-.oss-cn-hangzhou.aliyuncs.com/example-object.flv`.
*   The object must be URL-encoded by using the UTF-8 standard. For more information, see [URL encoding](~~423796~~).

Duration.description:
The duration of the clip.

*   Format: `hh:mm:ss[.SSS]` or `sssss[.SSS]`.
*   Examples: 01:59:59.999 and 32000.23.

SuperReso.description: The configurations for using the resolution of the source video.

IsHalfSample.description:
Indicates whether parameters related to the sampling rate are obtained. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false**

Map.description: The video track. Format: `0:{Stream}:{Stream sequence number}`, which is `0:v:{video_index}`. The value of Stream is v, which indicates a video stream. The sequence number is the index of the video stream in the list and starts from 0.

OutSubtitleFile.description: The details of the output caption.

RoleArn.description: The ARN of the RAM role used for delegated authorization.

Object.description: The name of the OSS object that is used as the output caption.

Location.description: The OSS region in which the output caption resides.

Bucket.description: The name of the OSS bucket in which the output caption is stored.

Success.description:
Indicates whether the job was successful. Valid values:

*   **true**: The job was successful.
*   **false**: The job failed.

Message.description: The error message returned if the job failed to be created. This parameter is not returned if the job was created.
Message.example: The specified parameter “%s” cannot be null.

VideoStreamMap.description: The sequence number of the video stream. The sequence number is the index of the video stream in the list and starts from 0. If no sequence number is specified, the default video stream is used.

OutputFile.description: The details of the output file.

RoleArn.description: The ARN of the RAM role used for delegated authorization.

Object.description: The name of the OSS object that is used as the output file.

Location.description: The OSS region in which the output file resides.

Bucket.description: The name of the OSS bucket in which the output file is stored.

Rotate.description: The rotation angle of the video.

Format.description:
The container format.

*   Default value: mp4.
*   Video formats include FLV, MP4, HLS (M3U8 + TS), and MPEG-DASH (MPD + fMP4).
*   Audio formats include MP3, MP4, Ogg, FLAC, and M4A.
*   Image formats include GIF and WebP. If the container format is GIF, the video codec must be GIF.
*   If the container format is WebP, the video codec must be WebP.
*   If the container format is FLV, the video codec cannot be H.265.

TimeSpan.description: The time span of the clip.

Seek.description:
The point in time when the clip starts.

*   Format: `hh:mm:ss[.SSS]`.
*   Example: 01:59:59.999.

Or

*   Format: `sssss[.SSS]`.
*   Example: 32000.23.

Duration.description:
The duration of the clip.

*   Format: `hh:mm:ss[.SSS]`.
*   Example: 01:00:59.999.

Or

*   Format: `sssss[.SSS]`.
*   Example: 32000.23.

MergeConfigUrl.description:
The URL of the merging configuration file. Only one of MergeList and MergeConfigUrl takes effect.

*   The configuration file specified by MergeConfigUrl can contain up to 50 clips.
*   MergeConfigUrl indicates the URL of the configuration file for merging clips. Make sure that the configuration file is stored as an object in OSS and that MPS can access the OSS object. For information about the file content, see the details about merging parameters.
*   Example of the content of the merging configuration file: `{"MergeList":[{"MergeURL":"http://exampleBucket****.oss-cn-hangzhou.aliyuncs.com/video_01.mp4"}]}`.

Opening.description: The opening parts. The value is a JSON object.

openUrl.description: The OSS URL of the opening part.

Start.description:
The amount of time after which the opening part is played.

*   The value starts from 0.
*   Unit: seconds.
*   Default value: **0**.

Width.description:
The width of the opening part.

*   Valid values: values in the range of (0,4096), -1, and full.
*   A value of -1 indicates that the original width of the opening part is retained.
*   A value of full indicates that the width of the opening part equals the width of the main part.
*   Default value: **-1**.

Height.description:
The height of the opening part.

*   Valid values: values in the range of (0,4096), -1, and full.
*   A value of -1 indicates that the original height of the opening part is retained.
*   A value of full indicates that the height of the opening part equals the height of the main part.
*   Default value: **-1**.

MuxConfig.description: The transmuxing configurations. The transmuxing configurations. If this parameter is specified in the request, the corresponding parameters in the specified transcoding template are overwritten.

FinalDelay.description: The duration for which the final frame is paused. Unit: centisecond.

DitherMode.description: The color dithering algorithm of the palette. Valid values: sierra and bayer.

IsCustomPalette.description:
Indicates whether a custom palette is used. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false**

Segment.description: The segment configurations. The value is a JSON object.

Duration.description: The segment length. Unit: seconds.

Start.description: The time when the ending part is played.

BgColor.description: The color of the bars that are added to the ending part if the size of the ending part is smaller than that of the main part. Default value: White. For more information, see [Parameter details](~~29253~~).

IsMergeAudio.description:
Indicates whether the audio content of the ending part is merged. Valid values:

*   **true**
*   **false**

Width.description:
The width of the ending part. Valid values: values in the range of (0,4096), -1, and full.

*   A value of -1 indicates that the original width of the ending part is retained.
*   A value of full indicates that the width of the ending part equals the width of the main part.
*   Default value: -1.

Height.description:
The height of the ending part.

*   Valid values: values in the range of (0,4096), -1, and full.
*   A value of -1 indicates that the original height of the ending part is retained.
*   A value of full indicates that the height of the ending part equals the height of the main part.
*   Default value: -1.

BlendDuration.description: The duration of the transition between the main part and the ending part. A fade transition is used: The last frame of the main part fades out, and the first frame of the ending part fades in. Unit: seconds. Default value: 0.

TailUrl.description: The OSS URL of the ending part.

CharEnc.description:
The character set used by the external caption.

*   Valid values: UTF-8, GBK, BIG5, and auto.
*   Default value: **auto**.

>  If the value of CharEnc is auto, the detected character set may not be the actual character set. We recommend that you set this parameter to another value.

FontName.description: The font of the hardcoded captions converted from external captions. Default value: SimSum. For more information, see [Fonts](~~59950~~).

Input.description:
The input caption file.

*   SRT and ASS files are supported. For more information, see the Input section of the [Parameter details](~~29253~~) topic.
*   Example: `{"Bucket":"example-bucket","Location":"oss-cn-hangzhou","Object":"example.srt"}`.

Object.description: The name of the OSS object that is used as the input caption file.

Location.description: The OSS region in which the input caption file resides.

Bucket.description: The name of the OSS bucket in which the input caption file is stored.

Map.description: The audio track. Format: `0:{Stream}:{Stream sequence number}`, which is `0:a:{audio_index}`. The value of Stream is a, which indicates an audio stream. The sequence number is the index of the audio stream in the list and starts from 0.

Width.description: The video width.

Height.description: The video height.

Duration.description: The video duration.

Fps.description: The frame rate of the video.

Bitrate.description: The video bitrate.

Index.description: The sequence number of the video stream. The value indicates the position of the video stream in all video streams.

Timebase.description: The time base of the video stream.

AvgFPS.description: The average frame rate of the video stream.

PixFmt.description: The pixel format of the video stream.

Sar.description: The sample aspect ratio (SAR) of the video stream.

Lang.description: The language of the video stream. For more information, see [FFmpeg documentation](https://www.ffmpeg.org/ffmpeg-all.html#Metadata) and [ISO 639](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO\_639-1\_codes).

CodecLongName.description: The full name of the codec.
CodecLongName.example: H.264 / AVC / MPEG-4 AVC / MPEG-4 part 10

Height.description: The height of the video stream in pixels.

Bitrate.description: The video bitrate.

CodecTagString.description: The tag string of the codec.

HasBFrames.description: Indicates whether the video stream contains bidirectional frames (B-frames).

Profile.description: The codec profile.

NetworkCost.description: The network bandwidth that was consumed.

PreloadTime.description: The amount of time consumed to preload the video stream.

CostBandwidth.description: The maximum bandwidth that was consumed.

Dar.description: The display aspect ratio (DAR) of the video stream.

CodecName.description: The short name of the codec.

Width.description: The width of the video stream in pixels.

Duration.description: The duration of the video stream.

Fps.description: The frame rate of the video stream.

bitsPerRawSample.description: The number of binary bits used by each sample or pixel.

Timebase.description: The time base of the audio stream.

Index.description: The sequence number of the audio stream. The value indicates the position of the audio stream in all audio streams.

ChannelLayout.description: The output layout of the sound channels.

Lang.description: The language of the audio stream. For more information, see [FFmpeg documentation](https://www.ffmpeg.org/ffmpeg-all.html#Metadata) and [ISO 639](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO\_639-1\_codes).

CodecLongName.description: The full name of the codec.

Bitrate.description: The bitrate of the audio stream.

CodecTagString.description: The tag string of the codec.

CodecName.description: The short name of the codec.

Duration.description: The duration of the audio stream.

Index.description: The sequence number of the caption stream. The value indicates the position of the caption stream in all caption streams.

Lang.description: The language of the caption stream. For more information, see [FFmpeg documentation](https://www.ffmpeg.org/ffmpeg-all.html#Metadata) and [ISO 639](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO\_639-1\_codes).

Format.description: The format information.

NumPrograms.description: The total number of program streams.

Size.description: The size of the media file.

NumStreams.description: The total number of media streams.

FormatLongName.description: The full name of the container format.

Duration.description: The total duration.

Bitrate.description: The total bitrate.

FormatName.description: The short name of the container format. Valid values: mov, mp4, m4a, 3gp, 3g2, and mj2.

FileSize.description: The size of the media file.

MultiSpeedInfo.description: The information about the high-speed transcoding job. This information is available only for jobs that are submitted by using an MPS queue for high-speed transcoding. This does not support MPS queues for high-speed transcoding of an earlier version.

Enable.description: Indicates whether high-speed transcoding is enabled.

Code.description: The error code returned if high-speed transcoding is not enabled.

Message.description: The error message returned if high-speed transcoding is not enabled.
Message.example: success

DowngradePolicy.description: The downgrade policy if high-speed transcoding is not supported.

Duration.description: The duration of the output video.

PipelineId.description: The ID of the MPS queue that is used to run the job.

Input.description: The information about the job input.

Object.description: The name of the OSS object that is used as the input file.

Location.description: The OSS region in which the input file resides.

Bucket.description: The name of the OSS bucket in which the input file is stored.

MNSMessageResult.description: The message sent by Message Service (MNS) to notify users of the job result.

MessageId.description: The ID of the message returned if the job was successful.

ErrorMessage.description: The error message returned if the job failed. This parameter is not returned if the job was successful.
ErrorMessage.example: The resource operated “%s” cannot be found.

ErrorCode.description: The error code returned if the job failed. This parameter is not returned if the job was successful.

SubmitTime.title: 任务出队提交执行的时间
SubmitTime.description: The time when the job was submitted.
